Description: Shoulder fragment of East Greek black-figured pottery open vase; thinly slipped on exterior; tongues at top of shoulder; in frieze below, sphinx to left, forepart preserved; incised and blob rosettes as fill; trace of perhaps further animal at left break; added red for the hair of the sphinx. paint fired to weak red (10 R 4/2).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 17, no. 52 pl. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.898)
